title: Dr
review: Went as a guest. Well maintained. Pride of the Regiment. Well maintained. History and footnotes biased to glorify the martyrs and make the history more colourful. Avoid going with kids. Requires patience. Recheck your facts. Interesting folklores. Worth a visit.

title: Good if you like history
review: It is inside the military area. Mark your entry at the gate. Vehicles can be taken till the museum gate. Parking is walking distance. Photography inside the museum is strictly prohibited.

title: History
review: The museum has done a great job to preserve the honours won by the Kumaon regiment. It does full justice to the bravery of its soldiers & the invaluable sacrifices.

title: Must visit place in Ranikhet
review: Glorifying history of Kumaon Regiment is exhibited here. Ranikhet is head quarter of Kumaon & Naga Regiment. All wars including world war-I & II history is exhibited, quite informative and pump up patriotism inside you.

title: The Legendary Kumaon
review: Great Army museum to visit.

title: Kumaon Regiment Museum-MUST VISIT
review: Kumaon Regimental Centre Museum is situated inside the Army cantonment area. You need to enter your details at the gate. Museum is awesome and very well maintained. You need to buy entry ticket and camera is not permitted inside. This museum is built and maintained by Kumoun  Regiment of the Army. Museum shows the portrays of the life at kumaon regiment. Attraction is Rani Jhansi sword. Chinese rifles/guns/flags/currency/uniforms/helmets/radio etc  used during the war of 1962 can also be seen. Casket of General Raina is also kept inside, read the history behind it. Many military items used and captured during the war with China are nicely displayed . Interesting place to visit. One of the best place to visit Ranikhet. You can also visit Shawl factory just outside this museum near entry gate.

title: nice museum
review: Those who are fond of warfare and patriotism should must visit this place.It was built  by Kumaon Regiment of the Indian Army in Ranikhet of Almora district. The museum shows the portrays of the life at Kumaon and Garhwal regiment, their war-life, sacrifices.The treasures include Rani Jhansi's argent scepters, abstracts of the Kargil War, Chinese rifles used during the 1962 war, a wireless acreage blast used in World War II by Japanese and the KRC Golf course. The casket of General TN Raina is also the attraction at the museum. There is also a shawl weaving center here.

title: A must visit
review: This museum gives a walkthrough of the history Kumao regiment, this is a guided tour and extremely well done. The presentation was fun and even my 6yr old enjoyed every bit of it. It also brings in a sense of pride on the achievements and the chivalry by the soldiers of the regiment.

title: Feel proud as an Indian
review: This regiment museum is a Must Visit Place In Ranikhet. Once u enter the premises u wl feel proud as an Indian and become a soldier.

title: History with a view
review: As cool as the title as true it is. Its a place to visit the old pieces of history amidst the beautiful and scenic view.

title: Excellent Defence Museum Ranikhet
review: The museum was a great surprise to us. The artifacts were excellent and dated ling back during second world war till the Kargil war. You have a entry fee and no photography.

title: Simply Amazing
review: This museum was simply amazing. The artifacts and actual wartime weapons were fantastic. Being a geek or not, one would simply love the place. It was extremely informative and gave a very good interpretation of the wars. It focuses on the Kumaon Regiment (of course) which has made our country proud. There are three levels in the building in which the first has a wide range of wartime pieces displayed. Second level focuses on the two main leaders from the regiment. The third level is for some movie related to all this.

title: Jai Hind
review: we went all the way to Ranikhet ,just to see this museum.

title: A must visit place in Ranikhet
review: Located at almost the center of Ranikhet, this place deserves visit for sure, dedicated to our brave soldiers. You will get a glimpse of the wars fought by our defense forces, enough to get the goose bumps.

title: Museum Review
review: This is at RANIKHET. Very very neat and clean surrounding, as is the trend in any Army Centre.

title: Knowledge hub for Army Fans
review: This is in Ranikhet but not in Almora.

title: Nice Museum
review: It is a very nice museum maintained by Kumaon Regiment,depicting the greats from the regiment.There history ,the tree chart and medals earned by hr regiment.You will appreciate there role in Kargil War with arms collected fro Pakistan army.You will love once you are there and like to salute the fellow soldiers for what hey have done for us.

title: Rich glory on display
review: This regimental museum is a must watch at Ranikhet. It's very well kept displaying exhibits from 17th/18th century pertaining to the Kumaon regiment.

title: The Glory of Indian Army
review: The museum is situated at ranikhet kumao regiment campus area. It requires a mere fee of 50rs person. Its a well organised and maintained museum.

title: History Well Preserved
review: The museum in Ranikhet is holding really a huge & valuable collection of India's military pride.. the prestigious & proud moments of our great victories over the enemies.. It has so much...  You are hold in the bygone era... Salute to our great fighters...

title: Very informative and good
review: The first and best part is you get access to discplined and immaculate vicinity of Army guys, you are generally not allowed in the army areas anywhere because of security reasons but this places give you that opportunity which if you are army lover is much satisfying in itself

title: What a way to dedicate a memorial to it's war heroes!
review: A great visit, made outstanding by the Retired but not tired Captain!. Hus knowledge, sense of pride and humour needs to be felt...

title: Not so great
review: Though it has got very very important war items, management is poor. A guide is too much nautanki. Army Memorablias sold without any receipt.

title: Kumaon Regimental centre Measeum.
review: I have installed child play way equipment there. Very organized and well maintained museum by the India Army. Nice and wonderful place to see.

title: Museum visit at Ranikhet
review: It was gr8 to visit this museum at Ranikhet.the prestigious & proud moments of our great victories over the enemies.

title: War and History!
review: Nice place to visit and know about the history of the kumaon regimen. Old war souvenirs and other war collectibles have been preserved.

title: We need more of these!
review: A museum dedicated to the military heroes of the Kumaon and Naga regiments. Its very informative and well-maintained. A must visit for all.

title: War Museum
review: A good place for visit in Ranikhet, if you are interested to see Old Arms, Certificates, Communication Technique and Weapons.

title: Museum is good..Host is awsome
review: Museum has very good collection of events and items which are in place. But the best part is the host who adds more interest in all the articles there by adding a story to each section, that too free of cost.Its a must must visit museum (even if you dont like museums that much)

title: A tribute to the most decorated regiment in Indian Army
review: The KRC Museum is a must visit for every person to see first hand the contribution of the armed forces to their homeland. The museum is very well organised and provides the visitor a detailed history about the regiment and its achievements over a period of time.

title: Respect the hIstory
review: Whe you pass thorugh Ranikhet, don't miss this museum. It depicts the history of formation and progress of the Indian army and kumaon Regiment. It depicts the bravery and sacrifice of the brave men of this regiment in the pre and post Independent India.

title: visit if u r a history buff
review: If u ve time in Ranikhet then u can go for visit. U do have to pay fees. Lot of history can be read. Professional maintained place. Fascinating to see how the regiment was formed from Nizam of Hyderbad to the British to till date. Also you get to know something on the Kumaon tribe history

title: India's Treasure of Courage and Honour
review: The moment you step into the Regimental Center, the air itself starts telling the stories of courage and discipline of brave soldiers. In the Officer's Mess of regimental center when you read the telegram sent by Major Shaitan Singh, PVC to his Regiment, you are full of gratitude and eternally thankful to these brave men, who were there so we are safe.

title: Don't miss
review: Other than the scenic beauty in Ranikhet this is the only place worth visiting. With very interesting exhibits ranging from formation of the Regiment alongwith captured and personal arms/uniforms of luminaries of the Regiment, the museum has been well maintained and curated.

title: War Museum to take you on the patriotic feeling
review: The war museum in Ranikhet is very well created. Takes a common man like me through all the aspects including history, weapons etc of war. The museum is well maintained.

title: very good museum
review: highly recomended for this museum for all visitors,this museum Maintained by the Kumaon and the Naga Regiment of the Army, the Museum has a collection ranging from stories of the heroics of the First World War till date. It has on display the various weapons captured, flags of enemies captured by the Army.

title: Army Museum Ranikhet
review: Wow what a museum. So much to know about warriors and history of Kumaon Regiment.

title: Museum with old rifles captured during world wars
review: If you are fond of warfare, this is a good museum to visit. They have rich history with samples of old rifles captured during world wars. Ask for the curator's tour guide at the beginning. Nice old chap will keep you engaged with the history and his jokes.

title: Informational and interesting
review: Museum well maintained and informational. Was my first visit to an army museum and enjoyed it. No photography allowed inside the museum. Lot of war stuff from 18th century to Kargil.

title: A Memorial and salute to Kumaoni Soldier
review: There is no question of dislike.It is a temple to pay tribute to Indian Kumaon soldier.The temple is beautifully designed,things beautifully kept,neat and clean,very good illustrations and display of weapons.A treat to be there.

title: Kumaon Center Museum
review: Fantastic Experience, with all beautiful memories. A good trip to know many unknown things. Good for the kids for good knowledge.
